intro: Raphionacme longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
